good.title: Enjoy Outdoor Activities
good.description: The air quality is good, so advantage of this by spending time outdoors. Engage in outdoor exercises like running, cycling, or hiking.

good.title: Keep Windows Open
good.description: Open windows and let fresh air circulate throughout your home or workplace to improve indoor air quality.

good.title: Stay Informed
good.description: Even though the air quality is good now, stay informed about any changes in air quality that might occur throughout the day.

moderate.title: Limit Outdoor Activities
moderate.description: While the air quality is not harmful, sensitive individuals should limit prolonged outdoor activities, especially if they experience any symptoms like coughing or shortness of breath.

moderate.title: Check Air Quality Forecasts
moderate.description: Stay updated on air quality forecasts and plan outdoor activities accordingly, especially if you're in a sensitive group.

moderate.title: Consider Using Air Purifiers
moderate.description: Consider using air purifiers indoors to further improve air quality, especially if you have respiratory issues.

unhealthy for sensitive groups.title: Reduce Outdoor Activities
unhealthy for sensitive groups.description: Individuals with respiratory or heart conditions, children, and older adults should reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion to minimize exposure to pollutants.

unhealthy for sensitive groups.title: Use Masks
unhealthy for sensitive groups.description: Consider using masks rated for particulate matter (such as N95 masks) if you need to spend extended periods outdoors, especially during physical activities.

unhealthy for sensitive groups.title: Keep Medications Handy
unhealthy for sensitive groups.description: If you have asthma or other respiratory conditions, ensure you have your medications readily available and follow your doctor's advice.

unhealthy.title: Stay Indoors
unhealthy.description: Everyone, especially sensitive groups, should avoid outdoor activities and stay indoors as much as possible to reduce exposure to pollutants.

unhealthy.title: Use Air Filters
unhealthy.description: Use high-efficiency air filters in air conditioning systems and consider running air purifiers indoors to reduce indoor air pollution.

unhealthy.title: Keep Hydrated
unhealthy.description: Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated, as this can help reduce the effects of exposure to pollutants on your respiratory system.

hazardous.title: Remain Indoors
hazardous.description: It's crucial to stay indoors and avoid all outdoor activities due to extremely poor air quality.

hazardous.title: Seal Windows and Doors
hazardous.description: Keep windows and doors tightly closed to prevent outdoor air from entering your home or workplace.

hazardous.title: Create Clean Air Spaces
hazardous.description: If possible, create a clean air space within your home using air purifiers with HEPA filters to provide a refuge from outdoor pollutants. Consider using a DIY air purifier with a box fan and a HEPA filter if commercial options are unavailable.
